result.execSummary:
The defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In amounts of:  $500.00 to Annie Y., and $1,000.00 to Paul F.

DNA sample.
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA AND restitution, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC. Balance paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment.  Obtain GED, HSED or diploma.
No contact with Paul F., Annie Y., and coactors Beverly Brown, Antonio Carr, Demetrius Parks, Michael Miller, Kyejuan Bankhead, Dongon Scott, Cameron Wonder-Rogers.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one and 15CF3316.  Credit for 655 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jajuan Wendell Payne

records.addlTxt:
Signed and Filed, Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 18, Judge COLON.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (38 pages) commencing JANUARY 18, 2017 received and filed.
Restitution Packet
Restitution Packet 01/26/2017
Count one.
Count two.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.  Additional statements by Delora B.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 years, concurrent to 15CF3316, credit for 655 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 years. 

As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count1 and 15CF3316, credit of 655 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No contact with Paul F., Annie Y., and co-actors Beverly Brown, Antonio Carr, Demetrius Parks, Michael Miller, Kyejuan Bankhead, Dongon Scott, Cameron Wonder-Rogers. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED, HSED or diploma.
- No further violations of the law.
-DNA sample.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Annie Y. and $1,000.00 to Paul F. out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
Restitution to be paid first. 
- Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA,  out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing 1-06-2017.  Defense counsel unable to appear.  Sentencing hearing now scheduled for 1-18-2017 at 8:30 am in Branch 18.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Defense requests an adjourned date.  No objection from the state. Neither party wishes to address the court on the record.  Case adjourned to branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1 and 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Jajuan Wendell Payne in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
